turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about DeWint House.
turn.1: What kind of visit did George Washington have to DeWint House?
turn.2: It was said to have been a friendly conference combined with an elegant dinner prepared by Samuel Fraunces, owner of Fraunces Tavern in New York City, who came up to prepare the dinner for Washington and his guest.
turn.3: Did he stay at the house?
turn.4: From November 11–14, 1783, a terrible snowstorm forced Washington to seek shelter in the DeWint House on his trip to visit West Point and later New York City, where he tendered his resignation.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The property was in disrepair when it was acquired by the Grand Lodge of Free and Accepted Masons of the State of New York in 1932.
turn.8: The site was declared a National Historic Landmark and was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1966.
turn.9: Is the house open to the public?
turn.10: The DeWint House, along with Stony Point Battlefield in Stony Point and the Blauvelt House in New City, are the only places in Rockland County designated as New York State "Paths through History" sites.
turn.11: Is the house preserved in any way?
turn.12: The site has undergone extensive restoration and upgrading.
